thread.title: More Ivanka Trump Products May Be Coming Your Way—From China
thread.title_full: More Ivanka Trump Products May Be Coming Your Way—From China

title: More Ivanka Trump Products May Be Coming Your Way—From China
text: February 21, 2017 Getty Images ICYMI, Ivanka Trump and her label have been the talk of the town. And still: Chinese companies are working to capitalize on the First Daughter’s fame with Ivanka Trump products patented in that country. Stateside, things don’t look good for the First Daughter’s business—major retailers including Nordstrom , Neiman Marcus and Belk have all dropped her lifestyle label (citing reasons purely performance-based—not politically motivated) and online sales of the brand are down. But in China, retailers are apparently chomping at the bit to capitalize on the idea that all press is good press—according to a report from Racked , Chinese businesses are in a race to trademark Ivanka Trump’s name. You May Also Like Lifestyle Meet Emily Bador: Model, Activist, And Body-Positive Instagram Queen According to the South China Morning Post , so far at least 65 different applications have been submitted to trademark the name “Ivanka” for use on products in China. The applications are hugely varied—we’re talking everything from “Ivanka” weight loss supplements to cosmetics to sanitary napkins. Yep, seriously. A batch of companies has also filed patents to use the Chinese characters for Ivanka’s name in a variety of enterprises. No word yet on whether or not these entrepreneurial enterprises will get the green light for their “Ivanka” branding, according to the report. More news on Ivanka Trump:
